entry.title: Learning Javascript
entry.content:
I’ve always been interested in learning Javascript, but have been too overwhelmed by the abundance of resources out there. I finally took the time to do some thorough looking around with lead me to this stack overflow link. This lead me to the MDN Javascript Reintroduction and Crockfords Lectures.

  • Mozilla Developer Network (MDN) Reintroduction

Crockford on Javascript

  • Volume 1: The Early Years
  • Chapter 2: And Then There Was JavaScript
  • Act III: Function the Ultimate
  • Episode IV: The Matamorphasis of Ajax
  • Part 5: The End of All Things
  • Scene 6: Loopage
  • Level 7: ECMAScript 5: The new Parts
  • Section 8: Programming Style & Your Brain

Now that I knew a lot of the theory behind Javascript, it was time to practice applying it. I decided to make a game.

MDN Game Development Workflows

  • 2D Breakout in pure JS
  • 2D Breakout game using Phaser
  • 2D Maze game with device orientation Phaser
